translation.text: SeaTac Airport Station 2nd pedestrian bridge elevator construction begins January 8, 2025.

Beginning January 8, 2025, through 2026, construction will take place at SeaTac Airport Station to add a new elevator to the pedestrian bridge. The new elevator will provide an additional option for passengers to travel from the pedestrian bridge to the pickup/drop off parking lot adjacent to the station. During construction, passengers can expect pedestrian walkways to occasionally be blocked or narrowed, and access to the current elevator periodically interrupted.

During times where pedestrian walkways are blocked and elevator access is unavailable, passengers may catch the Rapid Ride A Line bus from SeaTac Airport Station to Tukwila International Boulevard Station in order to use the 1 Line.  

The pedestrian bridge from the station to the airport will be unaffected and available throughout the duration of this project. 

Beginning February 10, 2025 half of the passenger pick up/drop off area will be closed, as will some parts of the plaza near the stairs and existing elevator as equipment begins to come in for construction of the new elevator.

Additional information about changes in elevator accessibility will be provided as it comes available.
East stairwell at South Bellevue Station Garage is closed

The east stairwell in the center of the South Bellevue Station Garage is closed until further notice due to needed maintenance. To exit the garage, please use the stairwells located along the perimeters of the north and south ends.

Affected lines:
2 Line
Elevator and Escalator upgrades at Int'l Dist/Chinatown Station

Sound Transit continues to upgrade elevators and escalators at International District/Chinatown Station. See below for current service status during the improvement process.

Exit A - to 5th Ave S & S Jackson St:
• Elevator 901 to Lynnwood platform – in service
• Elevator 902 to Angle Lake platform – in service
• Escalator 901 from Lynnwood platform – out of service
• Escalator 902 from Angle Lake platform – out of service

Exit B – to 5th Ave S & King St:
• Elevator 904 to Angle Lake platform – Currently out of service (Updated 10/20)
• Escalator 903 from Lynnwood platform – in service
• Escalator 904 from Angle Lake platform – in service
• Elevator 903 to Lynnwood platform – in service
• Southeast stairwell to/from Lynnwood platform – closed


Passengers who need assistance while at a Sound Transit station, can call or text Security at (206) 398-5268.
Starting on September 11 through November 14, the south parking lot at Lynnwood Transit Center will be closed to vehicles. This is to allow for construction of a new trash enclosure.

The ONLY vehicles allowed access during the construction will be those using the ADA parking spaces and paratransit bus service. We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause. 

To get information about other transit parking lots and garages, please click the link below. 

The work schedule is subject to change. For updates, please subscribe to service alerts. Visit the service alerts web page to sign up for alerts and current information on service disruptions.
University of Washington Station - Elevator 2 unavailable until further notice due to a mechanical issue.

The elevator at the Husky Stadium exit serving the street (Montlake Blvd NE), pedestrian bridge, and platform is out of service for the foreseeable future. 

During recent repairs, it was identified that a component in the elevator was damaged. The damaged component is not available for purchase separately, and a completely new machine will need to be ordered. These new machines have a significant lead time and the elevator will be out of service until repairs are complete. 

See below for alternate route information.

To ride the 1 Line:

1. Take the elevator located directly across from the out of service unit down to the platform.

To exit the station:

1. Take the nearby elevator located directly across from the out of service unit up to the street or pedestrian bridge to Montlake Blvd NE.

Testing for the 1 Line extension to Federal Way is underway. During testing, trains will continue south past Angle Lake Station. Passengers must deboard at Angle Lake. Service to Federal Way begins on Dec. 6.
On Sunday, Nov. 16, shuttle buses are replacing 1 Line service between Capitol Hill and Stadium stations. This all-day shutdown is for scheduled maintenance on the tracks.

Trains will run from Lynnwood City Center Station to Capitol Hill Station and from Stadium Station to Angle Lake Station. Trains run every 10 minutes.

Northbound passengers at Stadium and southbound passengers at Capitol Hill must transfer to the 1 Line shuttle buses to continue their trip. The shuttle buses will run every 10-15 minutes

Passengers can find 1 Line shuttle buses at the following stops:

Capitol Hill
- to Angle Lake: Broadway & E Denny Way - Bay 4

Westlake
- to Lynnwood: 3rd Ave & Pine St
- to Angle Lake: Pine St & 5th Ave

Symphony
- to Lynnwood: 3rd Ave & Union St
- to Angle Lake: 3rd Ave & Union St

Pioneer Square
- to Lynnwood: 3rd Ave & James St
- to Angle Lake: 3rd Ave & James St

Int'l Dist/Chinatown
- to Lynnwood: 4th Ave S & S Jackson St
- to Angle Lake: 5th Ave S & S Jackson St

Stadium
- to Lynnwood: SODO Busway & S Royal Brougham Way

Click the link below for alternate transportation options:
On Saturday, Nov. 8, 1 Line shuttle buses will replace 1 Line trains between U District and Westlake stations from the start of service to 2 p.m.

Sound Transit will upgrade fan ventilation equipment to improve system reliability. This work requires closing the University of Washington and Capitol Hill stations.

On Saturday, Nov. 8, shuttle buses will replace trains between U District and Westlake stations from the start of service until 2 p.m.

Regular 1 Line service will continue between Lynnwood City Center and U District stations, and between Westlake and Angle Lake stations.

Affected stops:

U District
- to Angle Lake: University Way NE & NE 43rd St (stop ID: 9134)

Univ of Washington
- to Lynnwood: NE Montlake Blvd & NE Pacific Pl Bay 4 (stop ID: 25755) 
- to Angle Lake: Montlake Blvd NE & NE Pacific Pl Bay 3 (stop ID: 25240)

Capitol Hill
- to Lynnwood: E John St & Broadway Ave E (stop ID: 29270) 
- to Angle Lake: E John St & 10th Ave E (stop ID: 29262)

Westlake 
- to Lynnwood: Pine St & 3rd Ave (stop ID: 1120)
Elevator outage at Westlake Station. The elevator serving the Lynnwood platform and mezzanine near Exit C is out of service until further notice due to unscheduled outage.

To ride the 1 Line to Lynnwood:

1. Go to the opposite end of the mezzanine toward Exit A.
2. Take the elevator down to the Lynnwood platform.

To exit the station:

1. Go to the opposite end of the platform.
2. Take the elevator up to the mezzanine. 
3. Continue to the desired exit.
Angle Lake Station Garage - Elevator 2 unavailable until further notice due to mechanical issues.

Angle Lake Station Garage elevator 2 is out of service until further notice.

Please use the adjacent elevator to access parking garage levels.
